text: From the other day talking about the $GME hold. This mad lads not letting leaving.

text: A friend of a friend of mine sold his apartment and went all in on GME yesterday :neutral_face:

elements.text: A friend of a friend of mine sold his apartment and went all in on GME yesterday

text: This is how the world ends, not with a bang but with a whimper

elements.text: This is how the world ends, not with a bang but with a whimper

text:
2020 was supposed to be the last season of Earth.
All the good writers left the series long ago.
They were trying to kill everyone off, with the fires, plague, and near-miss on the nuclear war.
Because you can do that in the final season.

But then Earth got renewed for 2021.
And noone in the writing room was prepared for it.
and now they are having to dig out of the waste paper bin all the half written scripts that were too trash even for 2020.

Which is how we get attempted coups in the US, and Reditors playing the stock-market for $5billion on freaking GameStop.

elements.text:

All the good writers left the series long ago.

Because you can do that in the final season.

But then Earth got renewed for 2021.
And noone in the writing room was prepared for it.
and now they are having to dig out of the waste paper bin all the half written scripts that were too trash even for 2020.

Which is how we get attempted coups in the US, and Reditors playing the stock-market for $5billion on freaking GameStop.

text: Elon Musk and Donald Trump both became two of the most powerful  people alive via memes

elements.text: Elon Musk and Donald Trump both became two of the most powerful  people alive via memes

text:
Elon did just tweet yesterday

> Gamestonk!!
:joy:
hurray a new kind of weaponized social media mob

elements.text: hurray a new kind of weaponized social media mob

text:
Oh wow I knew about the first bit where Reddit spotted that a hedge fund had a massive short on GameSpot and realised it could buy and hold and the price would have to go up til people started selling and the short would lose a ton on money.
I didn't realise that in response to losing a to of money the hedgefund had shorted GameSpot again.

I mean from a "rational" standpoint shorting GameSpot is even more correct than before. It's massively over valued. So it should return to its true value and the short should make money.

But memelords don't care about the "true value". They are going to keep holding it for the lolz.
